main event: On November 10, 1957, in Wellsville, New York, a very bright light was observed moving up and descending multiple times. It was described as 10 to 15 times larger than a star and had a white glow. The observation lasted for 15 minutes.
interesting points: The UFO was observed to be much larger and brighter than a star, with a white glow and moving up and descending.
The source found white objects ten times the size of objects were seen moving NW and were in sight for 15 minutes.
The conclusion was that it was possibly a balloon, but there was insufficient data for evaluation.
The observation was classified as a ground-visual type with one or two objects observed.
The UFO report was investigated as part of Project Blue Book, a U.S. Air Force program that looked into UFO sightings from 1947 to 1969.
sighted object: Bright light moving up and descending
witnesses: Yes, source found white objects ten times the size of objects were seen moving NW
